Package com.example.lotto649.Models

Class EventModel

java.lang.Object
com.example.lotto649.AbstractClasses.AbstractModel
com.example.lotto649.Models.EventModel
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class EventModel extends AbstractModel implements Serializable
EventModel represents an event in the application with attributes such as title, location, cost, description, number of spots, event type, and poster image. This model class also handles saving and updating event data in Firestore.
See Also:

  • Constructor Details

    • EventModel

      public EventModel()
      No-argument constructor for Firestore deserialization. This constructor is required for creating instances of the `EventModel` when reading from Firestore.

    • EventModel

      public EventModel(android.content.Context context, com.google.firebase.firestore.FirebaseFirestore db)
      Constructs a new EventModel with the specified context and Firestore database instance.

      This constructor initializes the event's title, facility ID, cost, description, number of spots, event type, and poster image with default values. It also generates a QR code for the event and saves the event data to Firestore.

      Parameters:
      context - the context in which this model operates, typically passed from an Activity or Fragment
      db - the Firestore database instance used to store event data

    • EventModel

      public EventModel(android.content.Context context, String title, String facilityId, double cost, String description, int numberOfSpots, Date startDate, Date endDate, boolean geo, com.google.firebase.firestore.FirebaseFirestore db)
      Constructor to create an EventModel instance. Automatically generates a QR code and initializes the Firestore database instance.
      Parameters:
      context - the application context
      title - the title of the event
      facilityId - the ID of the FacilityModel document representing the event location
      cost - the cost to attend the event
      description - a description of the event
      numberOfSpots - the number of spots available for the event
      db - the Firestore database instance

    • EventModel

      public EventModel(android.content.Context context, String title, String facilityId, double cost, String description, int numberOfSpots, int numberOfMaxEntrants, Date startDate, Date endDate, boolean geo, com.google.firebase.firestore.FirebaseFirestore db)

    • EventModel

      public EventModel(android.content.Context context, String title, String facilityId, double cost, String description, int numberOfSpots, int numberOfMaxEntrants, Date startDate, Date endDate, String posterImage, boolean geo, String qrCodeUrl, ArrayList<UserModel> waitingList, com.google.firebase.firestore.FirebaseFirestore db)
      Constructor to create an EventModel instance. Automatically generates a QR code and initializes the Firestore database instance.
      Parameters:
      context - the application context
      title - the title of the event
      facilityId - the ID of the FacilityModel document representing the event location
      cost - the cost to attend the event
      description - a description of the event
      numberOfSpots - the number of spots available for the event
      db - the Firestore database instance

    • saveEventToFirestore

      public void saveEventToFirestore()
      Saves the event data to Firestore. If the event has already been saved, this method does nothing.

    • getSavedToFirestore

      public boolean getSavedToFirestore()

      Returns:
      if saved to firestore as a boolean

      Parameters:
      savedToFirestore - the new Firestore save status

    • removeEventFromFirestore

      public void removeEventFromFirestore()
      Removes the event data to Firestore. If the event has already been removed, this method does nothing.
